name: VIENNA GAME
idea: The aggressive alternative to 2.Nf3! With 2.Nc3, White prepares f2-f4 (the Vienna Gambit) or Bc4 followed by d3 and f4. It's a dangerous attacking weapon that avoids the solid lines of the Italian and Spanish. The key idea: quick development and attack on f7. The Vienna can lead to sharp tactical battles or quiet positional games depending on Black's response. A great surprise weapon!
errors_white: Playing f4 without preparation: ...exf4 can be good for Black
Forgetting to develop: Bc4, d3, Nf3 must come before the attack
Being too slow: the Vienna is an attacking opening, play actively
errors_black: Being passive: ...Nf6, ...Bc5, ...d6 must fight for the center
Ignoring the f4 threat: ...d5 or ...d6 and ...Be7 handle it well
Taking on e4 too early: can give White a strong attack
development: Supports e4 and prepares d5 - logical development
The Vienna Gambit! Opens the f-file and attacks e5
Bc4 targets f7 - combined with Qh5 it's dangerous
Qh5 in certain lines threatens mate on f7
Nf3 or Nge2 depending on plan (f4 or not)
Kingside castle after Bc4/Be2 and Nf3

traps.name: Frankenstein Trap
traps.desc: 3.Bc4 Nf6 4.d3?! ...Nxe4! 5.Nxe4 d5 wins a piece since the Bc4 and Ne4 are both hanging! AVOID (White): Play 4.d3 only after f3, or play 3.f4 directly.

traps.name: Vienna Gambit
traps.desc: 3.f4!? exf4 and White sacrifices a pawn for open lines. If Black accepts, 4.Nf3 with compensation. AVOID (Black): Accept with ...exf4 but play solidly, or decline with ...d6.

traps.name: Max Lange Attack
traps.desc: 3.Bc4 and if ...Bc5?! 4.Qg4! Threatens g7 and f7. Black must defend precisely. AVOID (Black): Play ...Nf6 first to control g4 and e4.

variants.name: Vienna Gambit
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 b1c3 g8f6 f2f4 d7d5 f4e5 f6e4 g1f3
variants.white_plan: Open and tactical position. Develop Bd3, 0-0 and attack the Ne4. d3 to chase the Knight.
variants.black_plan: The Ne4 is active but exposed. ...Bc5 or ...Be7, ...0-0, ...Nc6 with active play.

variants.name: Falkbeer Variation
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 b1c3 g8f6 f1c4 f6e4 d1h5 e4d6 c4b3 b8c6
variants.white_plan: Qh5 puts pressure on f7 and e5. Nf3, d3, 0-0 with continued attack.
variants.black_plan: Defend f7 with the Nd6. ...Be7, ...0-0, then ...Nf5 to block the attack.

variants.name: Classical Variation
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 b1c3 b8c6 f1c4 f8c5 d1g4 d8f6 c3d5 f6f2
variants.white_plan: Crazy tactical position! After Kd1, White has active pieces but the King is exposed.
variants.black_plan: The Qf2 is aggressive. ...Kd8 puts the King to safety, then develop and attack.
